intro: Rhamnoides, commonly known as the common spurge, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Euphorbiaceae. It is characterized by its milky sap, which is often toxic and can cause skin irritation. The plants typically have simple, alternate leaves and small, inconspicuous flowers clustered in cyathia. Rhamnoides species are often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in a variety of habitats, including roadsides and wastelands. They are widely distributed across temperate regions of the Northern Hemisphere.
